judges: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE RAJIVE BHALLA  HON
acts_referred: Section 7 of the Punjab Village Common Lands (Regulation) Act
judgment_text:
Civil Writ Petition No.15026 of 1994(O&M)
-1-
IN THE HIGH COURT OF PUNJAB AND HARYANA AT
CHANDIGARH

 C.M.No.16621 of 2011 and
 Civil Writ Petition No.15026 of 1994

 Date of Order: 27.02.2012.
Ramdhan and others 
 ..Petitioners
Versus
State of Haryana and others ..Respondents
CORAM: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE RAJIVE BHALLA
 HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE RAKESH KUMAR JAIN
Present:Mr. B.S.Bairagi, Advocate
for the petitioner.
Ms. Shruti Jain, AAG, Haryana
for the State.
Mr. Mani Ram Verma, Advocate
for the applicant-respondent no.3.
RAJIVE BHALLA, J (Oral)
C.M.No.16621 of 2011
Prayer in this application is for early hearing.
Allowed as prayed for.
With consent of counsel for the parties, the writ petition
is being taken up for hearing.
C.W.P. No.15026 of 1994
The petitioners pray for issuance of a writ for quashing
proceedings, under Section 7 of the Punjab Village Common Lands
(Regulation) Act, 1961 (as applicable to the State of Haryana)
(hereinafter referred to as the '1961 Act'), pending before the
Assistant Collector Ist Grade, Dadri.
The petitioners claim that they are proprietors of Pana
Civil Writ Petition No.15026 of 1994(O&M)
-2-
Mahaigan, which created a Dholi in favour of Sham Dass Sadh son
of Mani Ram Bairagi Sadh Deredar. The land, therefore, does not
vest in the Gram Panchayat and the petition filed under Section 7 of
the 1961 Act could not be filed, against the Dholidar, without
impleading the petitioners. 
Counsel for the Gram Panchayat submits that as the
question of title has already been decided upto the Hon'ble Supreme
Court, the present petition may be dismissed and the Assistant
Collector Ist Grade, may be directed to proceed with the petition, filed
under Section 7 of the 1961 Act.
We have heard counsel for the parties.
Admittedly, a petition, filed under Section 7 of the 1961 Act
is pending. We, therefore, find no reason to keep the writ petition
pending and without expressing any opinion as to the merits of the
controversy, dispose of the writ petition with liberty to the petitioners
to raise all such pleas as may be available, in accordance with law,
before the Assistant Collector Ist Grade. 
Parties are directed to appear before the Assistant
Collector Ist Grade, Dadri, on 17.04.2012, who shall decide the
matter afresh and in accordance with law, within three months from
receipt of a certified copy of this order.
(RAJIVE BHALLA)
 JUDGE
February 27, 2012
 (RAKESH KUMAR JAIN)
nt
 JUDGE
